CreateDirectoryConfig.name: CreateDirectoryConfig
CreateDirectoryConfig.documentation: Creates a directory configuration with the given parameters.

CreateStreamingURL.name: CreateStreamingURL
CreateStreamingURL.documentation: Creates a URL to start an AppStream 2.0 streaming session for a user. By default, the URL is valid only for 1 minute from the time that it is generated.

DeleteDirectoryConfig.name: DeleteDirectoryConfig
DeleteDirectoryConfig.documentation: Deletes the directory configuration with the given parameters.

DeleteStack.name: DeleteStack
DeleteStack.documentation: Deletes the stack. After this operation completes, the environment can no longer be activated, and any reservations made for the stack are released.

DescribeDirectoryConfigs.name: DescribeDirectoryConfigs
DescribeDirectoryConfigs.documentation: Returns a list describing the specified directory configurations.

DescribeFleets.name: DescribeFleets
DescribeFleets.documentation: If fleet names are provided, this operation describes the specified fleets; otherwise, all the fleets in the account are described.

DescribeImages.name: DescribeImages
DescribeImages.documentation: Describes the images. If a list of names is not provided, all images in your account are returned. This operation does not return a paginated result.

DescribeSessions.name: DescribeSessions
DescribeSessions.documentation: Describes the streaming sessions for a stack and a fleet. If a user ID is provided, this operation returns streaming sessions for only that user. To retrieve the next set of items, pass this value for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation. If an authentication type is not provided, the operation defaults to users authenticated using a streaming URL.

DescribeStacks.name: DescribeStacks
DescribeStacks.documentation: If stack names are not provided, this operation describes the specified stacks; otherwise, all stacks in the account are described. To retrieve the next set of items, pass the nextToken value in a subsequent call to this operation.

ExpireSession.name: ExpireSession
ExpireSession.documentation: This operation immediately stops a streaming session.

ListAssociatedFleets.name: ListAssociatedFleets
ListAssociatedFleets.documentation: Lists all fleets associated with the stack.

ListAssociatedStacks.name: ListAssociatedStacks
ListAssociatedStacks.documentation: Lists all stacks to which the specified fleet is associated.

UpdateDirectoryConfig.name: UpdateDirectoryConfig
UpdateDirectoryConfig.documentation: Updates the directory configuration with the given parameters.

UpdateFleet.name: UpdateFleet
UpdateFleet.documentation: Updates an existing fleet. All the attributes except the fleet name can be updated in the STOPPED state. When a fleet is in the RUNNING state, only DisplayName and ComputeCapacity can be updated. A fleet cannot be updated in a status of STARTING or STOPPING.

UpdateStack.name: UpdateStack
UpdateStack.documentation: Updates the specified fields in the stack with the specified name.

DisplayName.documentation: The name of the application shown to the end users.

IconURL.documentation: The URL for the application icon. This URL may be time-limited.

LaunchPath.documentation: The path to the application executable in the instance.

LaunchParameters.documentation: A list of arguments that are passed to the application at launch.

Enabled.documentation: If there is a problem, an application can be disabled after image creation.

Application.documentation: An entry for a single application in the application catalog.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet to associate.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack to which the fleet is associated.

Running.documentation: The total number of simultaneous streaming instances that are running.

InUse.documentation: The number of instances that are being used for streaming.

Available.documentation: The number of currently available instances that can be used to stream sessions.

ConcurrentModificationException.documentation: An API error occurred. Wait a few minutes and try again.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory, such as corp.example.com

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The list of the distinguished names of organizational units to place computer accounts in.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The AccountName and AccountPassword values for the service account, which are used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

ImageName.documentation: Unique name of the image used by the fleet.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. Fleet instances are launched from this instance type. Available instance types are:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

ComputeCapacity.documentation: The parameters for the capacity allocated to the fleet.

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation: The maximum time for which a streaming session can run. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 600 and 57600.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. If a user who got disconnected reconnects within this timeout interval, the user is connected back to their previous session. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 60 and 57600.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The DirectoryName and OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName values, which are used to join domains for the AppStream 2.0 streaming instances.

CreateFleetRequest.documentation: Contains the parameters for the new fleet to create.

Description.documentation: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

DisplayName.documentation: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

StorageConnectors.documentation: The storage connectors to be enabled for the stack.

StackName.documentation: The stack for which the URL is generated.

FleetName.documentation: The fleet for which the URL is generated.

UserId.documentation: A unique user ID for whom the URL is generated.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application that must be launched after the session starts.

Validity.documentation: The duration up to which the URL returned by this action is valid. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 1 and 604800 seconds.

StreamingURL.documentation: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.

Expires.documentation: Elapsed seconds after the Unix epoch, when this URL expires.

DirectoryName.documentation: The name of the directory configuration to be deleted.

Name.documentation: The name of the fleet to be deleted.
The name of the stack to delete.

MaxResults.documentation: The size of each page of results.

NextToken.documentation: The DescribeDirectoryConfigsResult.NextToken from a previous call to DescribeDirectoryConfigs. If this is the first call, pass null.
If not null, more results are available. To retrieve the next set of items, pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to DescribeDirectoryConfigs.

Names.documentation: The fleet names to describe. Use null to describe all the fleets for the AWS account.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.documentation: A specific list of images to describe.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack for which to list sessions.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet for which to list sessions.

UserId.documentation: The user for whom to list sessions. Use null to describe all the sessions for the stack and fleet.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

Limit.documentation: The size of each page of results. The default value is 20 and the maximum supported value is 50.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication method of the user. It can be API for a user authenticated using a streaming URL, or SAML for a SAML federated user. If an authentication type is not provided, the operation defaults to users authenticated using a streaming URL.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.documentation: The stack names to describe. Use null to describe all the stacks for the AWS account.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory, such as corp.example.com

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The list of the distinguished names of organizational units in which to place computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The AccountName and AccountPassword of the service account, to be used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time stamp when the directory configuration was created within AppStream 2.0.

DirectoryConfig.documentation: Full directory configuration details, which are used to join domains for the AppStream 2.0 streaming instances.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet to disassociate.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack with which the fleet is associated.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory, such as corp.example.com

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName.documentation: The distinguished name of the organizational unit to place the computer account in.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The DirectoryName and OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName values, which are used to join domains for the AppStream 2.0 streaming instances.

SessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the streaming session to be stopped.

DisplayName.documentation: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

Description.documentation: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

InstanceType.documentation: The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. The fleet instances are launched from this instance type.

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation: The maximum time for which a streaming session can run. The value can be any numeric value in seconds between 600 and 57600.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. If a user who got disconnected reconnects within this timeout interval, the user is connected back to their previous session. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 60 and 57600.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time at which the fleet was created.

FleetErrors.documentation: The list of fleet errors is appended to this list.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Whether default internet access is enabled for the fleet.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The DirectoryName and OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName values, which are used to join domains for the AppStream 2.0 streaming instances.

ErrorCode.documentation: The error code for the fleet error.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message generated when the fleet has errors.

BaseImageArn.documentation: The source image ARN from which this image was created.

State.documentation: The image starts in the PENDING state. If image creation succeeds, it moves to AVAILABLE. If image creation fails, it moves to FAILED.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of an image to the user; images can be public or private.

ImageBuilderSupported.documentation: Whether an image builder can be launched from this image.

Platform.documentation: The operating system platform of the image.

StateChangeReason.documentation: The reason why the last state change occurred.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time stamp when the image was created.

PublicBaseImageReleasedDate.documentation: The AWS release date of the public base image. For private images, this date is the release date of the base image from which the image was created.

Image.documentation: New streaming instances are booted from images. The image stores the application catalog and is connected to fleets.

Code.documentation: The state change reason code of the image.

Message.documentation: The state change reason message to the end user.

ImageStateChangeReason.documentation: The reason why the last state change occurred.

IncompatibleImageException.documentation: The image does not support storage connectors.

InvalidParameterCombinationException.documentation: Indicates an incorrect combination of parameters, or a missing parameter.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The requested limit exceeds the permitted limit for an account.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack whose associated fleets are listed.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet whose associated stacks are listed.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

ResourceNotAvailableException.documentation: The specified resource exists and is not in use, but isn't available.

AccountName.documentation: The user name of an account in the directory that is used by AppStream 2.0 streaming instances to connect to the directory. This account must have the following privileges: create computer objects, join computers to the domain, change/reset the password on descendant computer objects for the organizational units specified.

AccountPassword.documentation: The password for the user account for directory actions.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The AccountName and AccountPassword of the service account, to be used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

Id.documentation: The unique ID for a streaming session.

UserId.documentation: The identifier of the user for whom the session was created.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack for which the streaming session was created.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet for which the streaming session was created.

State.documentation: The current state of the streaming session.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication method of the user for whom the session was created. It can be API for a user authenticated using a streaming URL or SAML for a SAML federated user.

Session.documentation: Contains the parameters for a streaming session.

SessionState.documentation: Possible values for the state of a streaming session.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time stamp when the stack was created.

StorageConnectors.documentation: The storage connectors to be enabled for the stack.

StackErrors.documentation: The list of errors associated with the stack.

ErrorCode.documentation: The error code of a stack error.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message of a stack error.

StackError.documentation: Contains the parameters for a stack error.

Name.documentation: The name of the fleet to start.
The name of the fleet to stop.

ConnectorType.documentation: The type of storage connector. The possible values include: HOMEFOLDERS.

ResourceIdentifier.documentation: The ARN associated with the storage connector.

StorageConnector.documentation: Contains the parameters for a storage connector.

StorageConnectorType.documentation: The type of storage connector. The possible values include: HOMEFOLDERS.

DirectoryName.documentation: The name of the existing directory configuration to be updated.

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The list of the distinguished names of organizational units to place computer accounts in.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The AccountName and AccountPassword values for the service account, which are used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory

ImageName.documentation: The image name from which a fleet is created.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. Fleet instances are launched from this instance type. Available instance types are:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

ComputeCapacity.documentation: The parameters for the capacity allocated to the fleet.

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation: The maximum time for which a streaming session can run. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 600 and 57600.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. If a user who got disconnected reconnects within this timeout interval, the user is connected back to their previous session. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 60 and 57600.

DeleteVpcConfig.documentation: Delete the VPC association for the specified fleet.

Description.documentation: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

DisplayName.documentation: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The DirectoryName and OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName values, which are used to join domains for the AppStream 2.0 streaming instances.

DisplayName.documentation: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

Description.documentation: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

Name.documentation: The name of the stack to update.

StorageConnectors.documentation: The storage connectors to be enabled for the stack.

DeleteStorageConnectors.documentation: Remove all the storage connectors currently enabled for the stack.

SubnetIds.documentation: The list of subnets to which a network interface is established from the fleet instance.
